Explanation.name: Weapon
Explanation.description:
These are the weapon attributes of this weapon.
The flags are as follows: - Must be readied is used for indicating that a weapon is used as a gametype objective for CTF or Oddball. - Doesnt count towards maximum allows the weapon to bypass the 2 weapon limit, but note that only four weapons can be held at once. - Aim assists only when zoomed prevents the weapon from engaging aim assist unless the player is zoomed in. - Prevents grenade throwing prevents the player from throwing grenades while the weapon is held. - Prevents melee attack prevents the player from performing a melee attack while the weapon is out. - Detonates when dropped causes the weapon to perform its detonation effect as indicated in the Item attributes. - Cannot fire at max age prevents the weapon from firing at all when it hits maximum age. - Secondary trigger overrides grenades results in the grenade button firing the second trigger instead. - Enables integrated night vision allows the weapon to have night vision when activating the flash light while zoomed in. - AIs use weapon melee damage has the weapons melee damage override the actors when performing a melee attack. - Prevents crouching prevents the player from crouching while the weapon is held. - Uses 3rd person camera puts the camera in 3rd person mode while the weapon is held.
For a unit to pick up the weapon, they must have animations available for this weapon that match the label tag.

Bit.name: does not depower active camo in multiplayer

String.name: label
String.description: Units that have this label in their animations will be able to pick up the weapon

TagReference.name: overheat detonation
TagReference.description: This effect is played when the weapon overheats and is set to detonate as a result

Explanation.name: Zoom Levels
Explanation.description:
These attributes are used for determining magnification levels of the weapon. The minimum zoom level is used for the first zoom level, and the maximum zoom level is used for the final zoom level. Zoom levels in between the minimum and maximum are interpolated. For example, if you have four zoom levels and the minimum was 2 with the maximum being 8, then the second and third zoom levels will be 4x and 6x, respectively.
When zoomed in, if the weapons HUD has a zoom overlay crosshair, it will appear. If there are multiple zoom levels, then it will changed to the next bitmap or sprite in its sequence every time the player zooms in. Note that if there are not enough bitmaps in the sequence, the game may crash (invader-build will check this).

RealBounds.name: zoom magnification range
RealBounds.description: Minimum is the magnification amount for the first zoom level, and maximum is the magnification amount for the final zoom level

Bit.name: use original unit adjust projectile ray

RealBounds.name: maximum rate of fire
RealBounds.description: This determines the maximum number of times this trigger can be fired per second. The first value is initial rate of fire and the second value is the final rate of fire. Weapons cannot fire faster than once per tick, and non-positive (0 or less) rate of fire results in firing once per tick. Because weapons cannot fire in between ticks, fire rate is also effectively rounded down to the nearest tickrate/n for any positive integer n (so at 30 ticks per second: 30, 15, 10, 7.5, 6, 5, 4.288, 3.75, 3.333, 3, etc.)

Real.name: acceleration time
Real.description: This is the number of seconds required to hold the trigger in order to reach the final rate of fire. 0 acceleration time means the trigger will always use the final rate of fire.

Real.name: deceleration time
Real.description: This is the number of seconds required to release the trigger in order to reach the initial rate of fire. 0 deceleration time means the trigger will revert to the initial rate of fire the moment the trigger is released.

ShortInteger.name: magazine
ShortInteger.description: This is the index of the magazine used for drawing ammunition for this trigger. If no magazine is given (null), then the weapon effectively has an unlimited amount of rounds.

ShortInteger.name: rounds per shot
ShortInteger.description: This is the amount of ammo each trigger fire uses. Unless the can fire with partial ammo flag is set, the trigger cannot be fired if there is less than this much ammo remaining and will, instead, reload automatically. Firing with partial ammo with the partial ammo flag will result in the loaded ammo reaching 0 rather than a negative amount. A negative value results in the magazine gaining loaded rounds upon firing.

ShortInteger.name: minimum rounds loaded
ShortInteger.description: The magazine will automatically reload if less than this much ammo remains in the magazine, and the weapon cannot fire unless this much ammo is loaded. Unlike rounds per shot, this ignores the can fire with partial ammo flag.

ShortInteger.name: projectiles between contrails
ShortInteger.description: Contrails will not be created until this many projectiles have been fired. This resets every time the trigger is released, and the first projectile will always have a contrail.

ShortEnum.name: prediction type
ShortEnum.description: behavior of the trigger in a network predicted game.

ShortEnum.name: firing noise
ShortEnum.description: This determines how AI will respond to the trigger being fired, if at all.

ShortInteger.name: projectiles per shot
ShortInteger.description: This is the number of projectiles that spawn when the trigger is fired.

AngleBounds.name: error angle
AngleBounds.description: This determines the maximum angle the projectile can deviate from the first person camera. The first value is the initial error angle and the second value is the final error angle.

RealVector3D.name: first person offset
RealVector3D.description: This is the relative offset from the first person camera the projectile spawns. X is front (+) and back (-), Y is left (+) and right (-), Z is up (+) and down (-).

TagReference.name: projectile
TagReference.description: This is the object that spawns when firing the weapon. The object will spawn facing the same direction as the first person camera (along with any error angle applied, if necessary) with the velocity of the shooter.
